props.synopsis: More details are emerging of how shocked locals rescued boat arrivals from the bush and why one mystery remains. What happened to the boat and how did the skipper get away?Â

props.synopsis: Constable Anthony Woods died after being dragged under a car during a traffic stop in Perth last year.

props.synopsis: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Lincoln is expected to re-intensify off the WA coast before making landfall near Exmouth over the weekend.

image.altText: Snowtown accomplice Mark Ray Haydon.

props.synopsis: Mark Haydon, who was convicted of seven counts of assisting the Snowtown murderers, will be sent to the Adelaide pre-release centre after being granted parole.

title.children: Snowtown accomplice Mark Ray Haydon granted parole

image.altText: A customer wheels a trolley past an aisle of a supermarket with ice cream in freezers.

props.synopsis: Award-winning ABC Sport presenter Karen Tighe announces she is leaving the organisation to focus on her health.

image.altText: An illustration of a man using two laptops.

props.synopsis: Tony found himself with too much time on his hands at work. What he did next challenges long-held notions of loyalty in the workplace.

title.children: 'Unethical and misleading': Tony was deceiving his bosses and raking in the cash

image.altText: An aerial shot of a pool at a theme park

image.altText: A close up of laptop screen

props.synopsis: Australian workers enjoyed an average base pay rise of 0.9 per cent in the December quarter, leading to an annual increase of 4.2 per cent over 2023,Â according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

title.children: Workers stop going backwards, as annual wage rises finally overtake inflation

image.altText: Fox standing in green grass.

props.synopsis: Scientists from Murdoch University will analyse the stomach contents of feral foxes after West Australian farmers culled hundreds of animals near the Stirling Range.

title.children: Record fox cull to give scientists fresh insight into the diet of Southern WA feral predators

image.altText: GHB liquid fantasy

props.synopsis: There have been 20 serious overdoses related to GHB consumption treated in Gold Coast hospitals in the past two weeks with doctors concerned the drug may contain lethal toxic additives.

title.children: Hospital admissions relating to party drug GHB double in past fortnight

image.altText: A man poses with his fist

props.synopsis: Police expect to chargeÂ Kwang Kyung Yoo with three counts of murder after the discovery of the bodies ofÂ a husband, wife and their child in two separate locations in Western Sydney yesterday.

image.altText: A man standing at a press conference

props.synopsis: Victorians face warnings of extreme heat and another storm threat just a week after a fire destroyed 46 homes in Pomonal and an intense storm killed a man in Gippsland.Â Â

title.children: Total fire ban issued for much of Victoria as hot, stormy weather returns

image.altText: A wooden house damaged by fire

props.synopsis: A 61-year-old Tweed Heads woman has been accused of not having compliant smoke alarms in the home, where six people lost their lives.

title.children: Woman charged following Russell Island house fire that killed five boys and their father

image.altText: A bogged four-wheel drive.

title.children: Google Maps error forces German tourists on survival trek with wild pigs, spiders and a croc for company

image.altText: A man wearing sunglasses and a face mask walks outdoors

props.synopsis: Stewart Iain Berry was sentenced to six years in prison after pleading guilty to sexually abusing a 15-year-old boy and producing child exploitation material.

title.children: Former prison guard sentenced to six years jail for child sexual abuse

props.synopsis: Dita Mitchell says she found greyhounds in "putrid" kennels with faeces and urine when she went to inspect her South East SA property after evicting a tenant.

image.altText: Placards, balloons, flowers and a shirt hang from a tree by the side of a road.

image.altText: A mountain of clothing in a landfill site in Ghana's capital Accra.

props.synopsis: Accusations fly thick and fast as a David and Goliath battle to save historic sports clubs in Toowoomba boils over.Â

title.children: Clubs try to stop historic venues from being bulldozed for 2032 Olympics

image.altText: Liberal party MP Moira Deeming exits from a joint party meeting, wearing a blue dress.

image.altText: Purple and yellow sketch-style illustration of two faces pressed against each other.

props.synopsis: Dating at any age can be nerve-racking, but if you haven't dated for decades it can be even harder. The good news: Dating in your 50s can still be fabulous, as these experts show.

title.children: Trial over handwritten lyrics to Hotel California set to begin
